Firewalls can be helpful for protecting your computer and personal information. Here are some things to consider:

• Firewalls help prevent unauthorized access to your computer. They block incoming connections that you haven't approved. This makes it harder for hackers and malware to get in.

• Firewalls are especially important if your computer is connected directly to the internet or a network. Firewalls can help shield your computer from threats on public Wi-Fi networks.

• Software firewalls, like Windows Firewall, are built into most operating systems. For many users, a software firewall provides enough protection. But hardware firewalls, like those in routers, provide an additional layer of security. 

• If you have a broadband router, it likely has a built-in firewall. You should enable it for basic protection. For stronger security, you can install a separate firewall software on your computer.

• Firewalls may cause some inconvenience. They can block certain programs and websites that you use. You'll have to configure the firewall to allow them.

• No firewall is 100% foolproof. Firewalls block many threats, but some malware may still get through. So you still need to use good computing practices, like strong passwords, to help protect your system.

Overall, for most home users, using the firewall built into your operating system and router provides good protection for basic security needs.
